meanings.definition: Make (a bill or other proposal) law.
meanings.sent1: The government enacted new rules to protect the environment.
meanings.sent2: The president enacted the new policy to improve healthcare.
meanings.sent3: The students enacted a funny play for the school talent show.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was enacted in every action she took.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's passion for teaching was enacted in every lesson.

meanings.sent1: The actors enacted a thrilling scene on stage.
meanings.sent2: She enacted the role of a detective in the school play.
meanings.sent3: The children enacted a silly dance routine at the party.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were enacted through his expressive gestures.
meanings.sent5: The singer enacted the lyrics with heartfelt emotion.
